p: Direct-acting antiviral agents are molecules that affect the non-structural proteins of HCV and block HCV replication. Three groups of DAAs are now available for the treatment of HCV. These include NS3/4A protease inhibitors, NS5A inhibitors, and NS5B polymerase inhibitors [ Figure 1]. The first-generation NS3/4A protease inhibitors (telaprevir and boceprevir) have been introduced for the treatment of HCV in combination with pegylated IFN and RBV (2011). The triple combined antiviral regimens (IFN/RBV/telaprevir or boceprevir) increased treatment success, but were poorly tolerated [ 13].
